intro: Lasiosiphon somalensis, commonly known as the Somali lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in racemes, and its leaves are alternate and ovate in shape. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
